availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, judge. Shelby County, Kentucky, native. Married Rosa Johnston. Father of John C. Johnston, Sue Johnston, George W Johnston, Ida Johnston, Henry S Johnston, Louisa Johnston, Eliza Johnston, and Flora Johnston. Represented Shelby County in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky for two terms and in the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky for one. Delegate from Shelby County to the 1849 Kentucky constitutional convention. Moved to Louisville in 1851. Judge of the Louisville City Court from 1854 to 1865. Elected Circuit Judge of the Seventh Judicial District of Kentucky in August 1865.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 5, page 221. Find A Grave, "George W Johnston ( - 1877)," Memorial #150314903, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=150314903&ref=acom, (accessed March 3, 2017). History of the Ohio Falls Cities and their Counties, Vol. I (Cleveland: L. A. Williams & Co., 1882), 511-12. John M. Palmer, Personal Reflections of John M. Palmer: The Story of an Earnest Life (Cincinnati: The Robert Clarke Company, 1901), 243.
